text: Practice Problem 3.48 (solution page 383) The functions int]en, len, and iptoa provide a very convoluted way to compute the number of decimal digits required Lo represent an integer. We will use this as a way to study some aspects of the Gec stack protector facility. int len(char +s) { return strlen(s); > void iptoa(char +s, long +p) € long val = +p; sprintf(s, "%1d", val); > int intlen(long x) € long v; char buf[12]; vex; iptoa(buf, &v); return len(buf); > The following show portions of the code for intlen, compiled both with and without stack protector: (a) Without protector int intlen(long x) x in krdi 1 intlen: 2 subq — $40, %rsp 3 movq — %rdi, 24(Yrsp)
